channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2024020513
item.description:
Report E-2024020513

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: LAURELDALE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PRESSIRIZING CARGO TANK FOR UNLOADING. PRODUCT ESCAPED FROM DOME COVER. INVESTIGATION CONFIRMED GASKET AND LID NOT PROPERLY MARRIED CAUSING RELEASE. ADJUSTMENT TO LID RESULTED IN LEAK BEING REPAIRD. UNLOADING COMPLETED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT. SPILL WAS CLEANED BY CONSIGNEE.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: DURING PRESSURIZING CARGO TANK FOR UNLOADING. INCREASED PRESSURE FORCED MATERIAL OUT OF MANWAY COVER. INVESTIGATION CONFIRMED DAMAGED LOCKING DEVICE ON DOME COVER CAUSED RELEASE. LOADING COMPLETED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT AFTER REPAIR. SPILLED CLEANED UP BY CONSIGNEE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN UNLOAD LEAKING. QA CLEANED SPILL AND UPON RESEARCHING THE SDS IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE A HAZMAT. QA SECURED PACKAGE IN YELLO DRUM AND PUT INTO HAZMA CAGE DescribePack: THE LID OF ONE OF THE CONTAINERS HAD COMPLETELY FALLEN OFF AND SOILED THE OTHER PAINT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS SEALED IN YELLOW DRUM

item.description:

  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet ripped torn open upon inspection of inner contents 6 x 2.5 liter plastic bottles of hydrochloric acid acs one 2.5 liter plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .50 liters to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 2.5 liter plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .50 liters to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report E-2024020467
item.description:
Report E-2024020467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPB experienced a UN1307 Unisol Liquid Red B-75 release from a 350-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote body. The crew confirmed the tote lid appear to be damaged by freight falling onto the lid. All free liquid was wiped off the damaged tote with absorbent pads and placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The tote was staged onsite pending a new lid from the shipper. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020445
item.description:
Report E-2024020445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: SCRANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 12, 2024, two (2) 35-pound cartons of UN3242 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lewis Environmental (LE) to remediate the impacted site. All powder was swept in with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews depalletized all affected product and placed them into five (5) 55-gallon drums. All drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.description:

  • City: NEWVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Received package from unload, noticed very strong gas odor. Checked the box for any signs of diamond labels or OP-900 labels. Upon not finding either, opened box to find two 2.5 Gallon containers labeled Kerosene. Immediately preformed damaged hazmat protocol for an undeclared hazmat. DescribePack: Loose cap on one container caused minimal amount of leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tightened cap on bottle.

item.title: Report E-2024020447
item.description:
Report E-2024020447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: ALLENTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill occurred inside of the trailer in Allentown, PA. The spill consists of (1) 55 gallon metal drum of , Isopropyl alcohol (UN1219) which was found damaged with a loose lid and sloshed out of the drum during unloading, causing approximately 1 gallon to spill out onto the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who were comfortable cleaning the spill with Oil Dri and PPE on site, the used absorbents, PPE and product were placed into an 85 gallon metal drum for disposal on site for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024021095
item.description:
Report X-2024021095

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver brought the leaker to QA cage 1, stating that it was leaking and it could not be delivered. The package was immediately put into a lined spill bin while the SDS was pulled up. The SDS revealed it was a limited quantity and needed to be processed as a damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Box was soggy and the bottles had broken through the wet cardboard. One bottle had completely leaked and was tipped over. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box put into tote to prevent more leakage, lids were tightened
